TopicTitle: Logitech Extreme 3D Pro not working in Mac OS

Articles.Content:
I've been happily using my Logitech Extreme 3D Pro to Kerbal in Snow Leopard for some time now, but I finally decided to get a new computer with the latest OSX (10.10.4). KSP runs great on the new system, but I'm having trouble getting my joystick to work: I first went to assign axes and the joystick motion was detected just fine, but I couldn't save the setting and the game hung. Now whenever I try to assign axes the joystick is not detected, and looking thru my KSP.log file it seems the input isn't being detected by KSP at all. I tried a fresh install of KSP to no effect, anyone have any thoughts on how I might fix it? Thanks for your help!

Edited September 3, 2015 by jao
There's a lot of controller binding issues, sorry, but it's interesting to hear it worked in Snow Leopard, was this with the current release of KSP?
No, it was back in 0.90. Sounds like other people are having issues post 1.0, so perhaps it is a Squad issue; here's hoping it's resolved in the next update!

I have the exact same issue with OS X 10.10.5 and KSP 1.0.4. Joystick detected once, but could not save the bindings. Restarted the game and no more joystick detected in KSP.
